text: Is this ID unique for each account globally?

hello world

let me know if you have any questions

can the HubSpot tracking code be considered a third party cookie if placed on a non HubSpot domain (like a wordpress site)?

i feel like i should know this
Well it seems like they are definitely a third party cookie:
But still looking for a definite answer
although if the domain is connected to HubSpot I think it would be a first party cookie
someone smarter than me needs to confirm though
Hello Carter, Is there a solutions for this?
Did you click on that link?
yeah, that is how I understand it. From domain is 1st party

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!
ha, I've never seen that before
LOL
Thats funny on two levels
seriously, thanks.
100% of course

So what the issue was is that I didn't have a developer account created on HubSpot, once I did that, the areas in that link you sent were there. I guess first thing to check is if a user has a developer account linked to the main account: <https://app.HubSpot.com/developer/>
:man-facepalming:
This is the HubSpot conversation-related postman collection. Inorder to send a message into a thread, I need to pass the channelId there. How can I find that channelId in my HubSpot account.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversations/conversations#channels>

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
It gives a 404 error
do you want to try this url? `<https://api.hubapi.com/conversations/v3/conversations/channels>`
yes

Hey all - I am new here and trying to figure out how to setup a new CMS dev environment from a HubSpot site that was migrated by the HubSpot team.

I have been able to sync the files from our “prod” to a new CMS “dev” account but I don’t know how to get the previews and stuff set up in the new “sandbox” If someone has a nice guide or would be willing to hop on a call and screenshare I am happy to pay for the time

Hi everyone! Anyone know how to prevent a record from being associated with another record if a specific property has a certain value, please? Ex. Custom object Units has a field “Status”: available, blocked. I would like to restrict only Units that are “available” to be associated to a Deal.
This isn't any out of the box way to do it, but you could setup a workflow that watches associations and checks them to make sure they're all valid and if they aren't valid delete it
Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>! I’ll try this way/
of course

Can anyone answer whether snippets of style code in the head (Advanced options -> Additional code snippets) of a blog post only work when the article is published? This snippet doesn't seem to be working in [draft] preview.
No it would work in draft mode too

Can't figure out why I can't put a media query in there that targets a specific paragraph (by ID) in a rich text module section of the blog.

I just want to apply a clear: both when on mobile, but it's not grabbing the class or the ID.
Can you screenshot where you put your code?
What are you trying to do with clear: both?
On mobile, I want that paragraph to clear below the div above that contains an image and a caption.
Try display: block
Dammit. I found it. I was using a comma in the css instead of a semi. I had JSON on the brain.
Lol
I didn't even see that
I haven't used 'clear' in like 8 years. Don't even remember what it does

Yeah. Well...a can't really bother with a whole grid in this stupid article. Just takes too long. I just wanted to fix some text wrapping on mobile. I think this has got it though. Magic!

Thanks for helping me not go crazy.
